titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lynch family photographs V1981.287
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T14:13-0500

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two copy prints, circa 1909, showing the the front porch of 113 Clinton Street in Brooklyn Heights, home of Dr. John J. Lynch and Jane Francis Lynch, and a portrait of Francis Jane Lynch.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Copyright will remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. All images in this collection will enter the public domain by 2039. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Lynch family photographs, V1981.287, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown.
